definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: The lymphoedema of the right lower limb gradually subsided with softening of the skin after operation.
sentences.chinese: 右下肢的淋巴水肿在手术后逐渐改善并且皮肤变软。

sentences.english: Remove from the pan to copping board until completely soft.
sentences.chinese: 等红椒完全变软了，取出放到干净的砧板上。

sentences.english: Put some spaghetti into the boiling water and boil it until it is tender.
sentences.chinese: 在开水中放一些细通心面，一直煮到面条变软。

sentences.english: Add the morels and shallots and sweat until soft, about 3 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 加入羊肚菌和红葱头，加热使之变软，约3分钟。

sentences.english: Soak for at least 20 minutes, until soft.
sentences.chinese: 至少泡浸20分钟，直到变软。

sentences.english: Hit men, then women can also become hard-soft.
sentences.chinese: 碰上男人，再硬的女人也会变软。

sentences.english: Cook onion slice , celery and garlic on the side till softened.
sentences.chinese: 再另一边炒洋葱，芹菜粉跟大蒜，直到材料变软。

sentences.english: Anneal means make harden steel soft and remove brittleness.
sentences.chinese: 退火就是使淬火钢变软并消除其脆性。

sentences.english: Cabbage leaves can be steamed or cooked in a small amount of boiling water until they soften.
sentences.chinese: 卷心菜叶子可以放在少量的沸水中蒸或煮直到变软。

sentences.english: Most likely a bit of bicarb too to soften it up.
sentences.chinese: 很可能加过一点碳酸氢钠让它变软。

sentences.english: Sagging springs. Spring will sag from overloading or if they have become weak.
sentences.chinese: 重载或者弹簧变软均会引起弹簧下垂。

sentences.english: Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until carrots are tender.
sentences.chinese: 煮滚，小火煨煮10分钟或直到胡萝卜变软。

sentences.english: Then, as blazing sunshine alternated with drenching rains, the harsh, barren surfaces of the black rocks slowly began to soften.
sentences.chinese: 之后，日照雨淋，贫瘠的黑岩地表慢慢开始变软。

sentences.english: Add the juice of half a lemon to a bowl of cold water.
sentences.chinese: 在一碗冷水中加入柠檬汁，把变软的生菜放进去。

sentences.english: In a saute pan, set over medium-low heat, cook onions until soft.
sentences.chinese: 置一平底煎锅，中低档火候，炒洋葱使其变软。

sentences.english: The candle softened and melted in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 蜡烛在太阳光下变软而熔解。

definition: (of food etc) soft/pulpy/(Tw) (of a person) lacking drive/shiftless/lazy
